DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Administration Route Code SNOMED CT Route Codes
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:A way of getting from one place to another; an established line of travel or access; the way a chemical or pollutant enters an organism after contact, particularly, the way of drug administration.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:A way of getting from one place to another; an established line of travel or access; the way a chemical or pollutant enters an organism after contact, particularly, the way of drug administration.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
A way of getting from one place to another; an established line of travel or access; the way a chemical or pollutant enters an organism after contact, particularly, the way of drug administration.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Based on HL7 FHIR value set for CDM.

DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and HL7 FHIR value set for CDM.
